[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Personal Finance Management System (PFMS) enables users to manage personal finances by tracking income, expenses, investments, and budgets to achieve financial goals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PFMS includes features for tracking income/expenses, budgeting, investment monitoring, and generating reports and alerts.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PFMS integrates with banking and investment platforms to sync data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PFMS provides web and mobile apps.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PFMS supports smartphones, tablets, and desktops.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PFMS uses secure APIs for communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PFMS sends alerts via email, SMS, and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PFMS manages financial activities like budgeting, tracking expenses, and alerts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PFMS customizes notifications and settings according to user preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PFMS Integrates with third-party financial tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PFMS tracks income/expenses, categorizes them, summarizes over time, tracks investments, provides real-time data, and offers budgeting tools to create, manage budgets, set alerts, and access financial resources for better management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PFMS serves individuals, business owners, students, and anyone needing financial tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PFMS requires internet access for syncing and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PFMS depends on secure APIs and data storage services.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall link bank accounts for transaction tracking and budgeting.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with investment platforms for portfolio syncing.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall share financial data with third-party tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall track income/expenses, categorize them, summarize over time, and track investments and provide real-time performance data (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for managing income, expenses, and budgets.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall sync data with external platforms in under 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall generate real-time reports to track financial progress within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store financial data with encryption.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support cross-platform functionality and ensure compatibility across devices.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall have a responsive design for all screen sizes.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for personal data handling and meet PCI-DSS standards for payment data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall use encrypted communication for all data transfers.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure high availability with minimal downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Test integration, syncing, alerts, and budgeting.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API docs, compliance, and best practices.
[SEC] 5. References: Personal finance guidelines, GDPR, and investment monitoring practices.
